page.title: 08CHEESE MAKING TODAY
page.content: In West Pennard there is a cheese making farm which has been run by the same family for over 65 years.Its milk comes from about 900 cows on this and two other farms in the area. Over 2000 gallons of milk are used each day and each gallon makes 1lb of cheese. After quick heating and cooling to kill germs, rennet is added to separate the milk into liquid whey(which is drained off to make cream,butter and pig food) and the solid, rubbery, tasteles curds which are chopped, salted and put into moulds. After pressing, the moulds are removed and the cheese is wrapped in waxed cloths and stored in controlled conditions to mature. The resulting Cheddar cheeses are sold at about one year old. Some are sold from the farm, others go to local shops or distributers.Some are sold in a famous London department store at Christmas.
